alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Niagara; Northern Erie; Orleans (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 1:38PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Erie, Niagara, western Orleans and northwestern Genesee Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 137 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Erie Basin Marina, or 7 miles west of Buffalo, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, Niagara Falls, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lockport, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Lancaster, Medina, Williamsville, Grand Island, Newfane, Pendleton, Pembroke and Akron. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 48A and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
